what: A package for Blanco Center staff
title: blancocentR
text: package includes resources help achieve cohesive look Blanco Center data visualizations. main use blancocentR conjunction ggplot2, colors can used across tools, included data can useful applications don’t involve data visualizations.

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff
title: blancocentR
text: BlancocentR includes two data objects help working Louisiana’s 64 parishes region designations different state agencies organizations: tibble parishes includes parishes regions, louisiana sf object includes population estimates, geometry, center points parish addition included parishes. can access data via blancocentR::parishes blancocentR::louisiana, can load environment. Let’s load ! can now plot simple map Louisiana outlines parish.  can use ‘fill’ aesthetic designate different regions, e.g., DCFS regions.
code: data(parishes) data(louisiana) library(ggplot2)  p1 <- ggplot(louisiana) + geom_sf() p1 p2 <- ggplot(louisiana) + geom_sf(aes(fill = region_name_DCFS), show.legend = FALSE)  p2

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff
title: blancocentR
text: Sometimes ’s useful parish polygons also region polygons. Maybe ’d like map Louisiana’s parishes show region boundaries without using ‘fill’ regions. Maybe ’d like plop region’s name center area. can using get_region_geometry(). Let’s use DCFS regions example! sf object changed 64 observations (one parish) 9 observations (one DCFS region). Let’s plot map!
code: dcfs_regions <- get_region_geometry(louisiana, region_DCFS, region_name_DCFS) ggplot(dcfs_regions) +    geom_sf(data = louisiana) + # parish boundaries   geom_sf(lwd = 0.7, fill = NA) + # region boundaries   geom_sf_text(aes(label = region_name_DCFS)) # region names

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff
title: blancocentR
text: BlancocentR includes Blanco Center theme, theme_bc(). theme defines use font families, sizes, colors different aspects plot structure. base text defined using sans serif font (“Quicksand”) size 12 color light_text (“#575E66”). plot structure (e.g., axis lines, ticks, text) use color light_text well, titles (plot title, legend title, axis titles) emphasizes using serif font “Bitter” color dark_text. extra emphasis ULL color branding, plot title uses ull_red (“#a00b0b”). default position legend defined theme top plot horizontal direction can changed needed. can customize theme changing arguments. Let’s create additional example plots use throughout tutorial. Let’s see plot p4 looks add theme:
code: library(scales) p3 <- ggplot(louisiana) +    geom_point(     aes(x = estimate, y = region_name_DCFS, color = region_name_DCFS),     size = 3) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = label_number(scale_cut = cut_short_scale())) +   labs(title = "Louisiana population in 2023",         subtitle = "Parish population by DCFS region",         caption = "Source: U.S. Census, 2023 ACS 5-Year estimates, Table B01003",        y = NULL,         x = NULL) p3 +    theme_bc()

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The theme
title: blancocentR
text: like, can add grid lines. p4, can add x grid lines. wouldn’t make much sense add y grid lines, can want using theme_bc(grid_y = TRUE).
code: p3 + labs(title = "Now with grid lines!") +    theme_bc(grid_x = TRUE) +    theme(legend.position = "none") # remove legend

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The theme
title: blancocentR
text: maps look better without axes. can take advantage ‘void’ argument remove axes one simple step.
code: p1 +    labs(title = "Louisiana",         subtitle = "A map showing all 64 parishes") +   theme_bc(void = TRUE)

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff
title: blancocentR
text: package includes several color palettes, list named colors, individual colors. Please note accessing colors may different use package experience sourcing colors R scripts.

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The colors
title: blancocentR
text: Named colors accessible ’ve loaded package without showing environment.

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The colors
title: blancocentR
text: Miscellaneous colors still available name. can call specific color collection naming specifically, e.g., misc_pal$jadegreen, print whole list calling misc_pal.  miscellaneous palette also available palette function use directly ggplot discrete variables. See Palette functions palette functions general, Miscellaneous palette use palette.
code: library(scales)  list(   # row 1   "midnight" = "#243e56",    "mint" = "#bcefde",    "berry" = "#8f555a",    "sand" = "#e8d5a6",    "mustard" = "#ae9837",       # row2   "charcoal" = "#3c424e",    "jadegreen" = "#4e7a59",    "pastelgreen" = "#7fc791",    "deepforest" = "#253a2a",    "darkteal" = "#23464f", # urban      # row 3   "cloudfree" = "#62c3dc",    "midblue" = "#5ea2e3",    "silver" = "#94b3b0",    "strawberry" = "#d24a41", # rural   "peachy" = "#f9785e",       # row 4   "blush" = "#eb8d83",    "darkcherry" = "#852f29",    "darkplum" = "#4f2f32",    "darkmaroon" = "#5e3934",    "lilac" = "#a8b9da",       # row 5   "vintageviolet" = "#77839b" # 9th region color )

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The colors
title: blancocentR
text: Palette functions generate list colors can used directly ggplot code using, e.g. scale_color_manual() scale_fill_manual(), depending mapped aesthetics.

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The colors > Palette functions
title: blancocentR
text: Region palettes map region identifier specific color. Region identifiers can either names numbers. Let’s take look:  Similarly color aesthetics, can map fill:  works mapped color/fill aesthetics variable ‘region_name_DCFS’ (can see legend title). region color palette assign colors region name opposed region number default. object dcfs_regions, numeric variable ‘region_DCFS’ character variable ‘region_name_DCFS’. region variables parishes louisiana follow pattern. prefer map color region number instead, ’ll need convert region’s numeric value discrete value (e.g., using factor()) specify use region number rather region name inside dcfs_palette() via ‘region’ argument. step, can also darken color region 9 - Monroe using ‘darken’ argument.  legend title now “factor(region_DCFS)” colors mapped numeric counterpart region names.
code: p3 +    scale_color_manual(values = dcfs_palette()) +    theme_bc() +    theme(legend.position = "right") p2 +    scale_fill_manual(values = dcfs_palette()) +    theme_bc(void = TRUE) +    theme(legend.position = "right") ggplot(louisiana) +    geom_point(aes(     x = estimate,     y = region_name_DCFS,     color = factor(region_DCFS) # note the use of factor()     )) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = label_number(scale_cut = cut_short_scale())) +   scale_color_manual(values = dcfs_palette(     region = "number", # use "number" instead of default "name"     darken = 1 # darken by 1     )) +   labs(title = "Louisiana population in 2023",         subtitle = "Parish population by DCFS region",         caption = "Source: U.S. Census, 2023 ACS 5-Year estimates, Table B01003",        y = NULL,         x = NULL) +    theme_bc() +    theme(legend.position = "right")

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The colors > Palette functions
title: blancocentR
text: Gradient palettes, just like palettes blancocentR, generate colors. default number colors 7 can adjust number colors using ‘n’ argument. function generates number colors, can’t use directly continuous variables, discrete variables. However, can make use scale_fill_gradient() defining ‘low’ ‘high’ arguments like :  previous example, use 7th color ‘high’ didn’t define number colors palette generates. default, number 7, 7th color lightest color. can achieve exact result generating n colors selecting nth value ‘high’, e.g. using n = 2:  Note: also adjust base color used generate palette ‘base’ argument, ’s recommended. hood, function uses monochromeR::generate_palette()1. gradient palettes: la_gradient_palette()  us_gradient_palette()  ur_gradient_palette()  ru_gradient_palette()
code: ggplot(louisiana) +    geom_sf(aes(fill = estimate)) +    scale_fill_gradient(   low = la_gradient_palette()[1],    high = la_gradient_palette()[7]   ) ggplot(louisiana) +    geom_sf(aes(fill = estimate)) +    scale_fill_gradient(   low = la_gradient_palette()[1],    high = la_gradient_palette(n = 2)[2]   ) show_col(paste(la_gradient_palette())) show_col(paste(us_gradient_palette())) show_col(paste(ur_gradient_palette())) show_col(paste(ru_gradient_palette()))

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff > The colors > Palette functions
title: blancocentR
text: can access miscellaneous colors two ways: 1) via printing list named colors /individual directly console (see Miscellaneous colors), 2) via function misc_palette(). Just like palette functions blancocentR, function generate colors, 21 exact. can use colors directly ggplot using scale_*_manual(values = misc_palette()), depending mapped aesthetics. work long 1) variable discrete, 2) variable doesn’t exceed 21 distinct levels2.
code: p3 +    scale_color_manual(values = misc_palette()) +    theme_bc() +    theme(legend.position = "none") +   labs(subtitle = "These are colors from the Miscellaneous palette!")

previous_headings: A package for Blanco Center staff
title: blancocentR
text: Wait, function haven’t talked ? show_cvd() helper function allows quickly compare selected colors might look like someone color vision deficiency, print gray-scale. output shows 5 rows: original input colors deuteranope simulation (green cone cells defective) protanope simulation (red cone cells defective) tritanope simulation (blue cone cells defective) desaturated (gray-scale)  Note: hood, function uses scales::show_col()3 functions {colorspace}4 package.

what: A helper package for Blanco Center staff
title: A helper package for Blanco Center staff
text: goal blancocentR facilitate easy mapping Louisiana’s 64 parishes various region designations, well allow cohesive data visualizations across Blanco Center using Blanco Center theme colors.

title: A helper package for Blanco Center staff
text: can install development version blancocentR GitHub :

title: A helper package for Blanco Center staff
text: detailed package documentation, please visit pkgdown site.

title: A helper package for Blanco Center staff
text: basic example can use louisiana data, Blanco Center theme, Blanco Center colors specific DCFS regions:
code: library(blancocentR) library(ggplot2)  data(louisiana) ggplot(louisiana) +    geom_sf(aes(fill = region_name_DCFS)) +    scale_fill_manual(values = dcfs_palette()) +    labs(title = "Louisiana map",        subtitle = "Regions via DCFS") +   theme_bc(void = TRUE) +    theme(legend.position = "right")

what: blancocentR: A helper package for Blanco Center staff — blancocentR-package
title: blancocentR: A helper package for Blanco Center staff — blancocentR-package
text: package Blanco Center staff facilitate cohesive look across data visualizations. package includes ggplot2 theme, colors color palettes, two data files Louisiana's 64 parishes region designations different agencies organizations (one one without geometry), function join parish polygons region polygons. palettes built using 'monochromeR' package provides methods blending colors. Shapefiles population data U.S. Census acquired via 'tidycensus' package.

title: blancocentR: A helper package for Blanco Center staff — blancocentR-package
text: Maintainer: Claudia Laurenzano claudialaurenzano@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: A ggplot2 theme for Blanco Center visualizations — theme_bc
title: A ggplot2 theme for Blanco Center visualizations — theme_bc
text: theme_bc() adds Blanco Center theme plot created using ggplot(). Customize plot elements like font family color axis colors line sizes. Grid lines x y axes can added, axes can removed, e.g. maps.

title: A ggplot2 theme for Blanco Center visualizations — theme_bc
code: theme_bc(   title_font = "Bitter",   base_font = "Quicksand",   dark_text = "#1A242F",   light_text = "#575E66",   void = FALSE,   grid_x = FALSE,   grid_y = FALSE,   base_size = 12,   base_line_size = base_size/22,   base_rect_size = base_size/22 )

title: A ggplot2 theme for Blanco Center visualizations — theme_bc
text: title_font Font used titles: plot title, axis titles, legend title. base_font Font used text. dark_text Color used axis legend titles. light_text Color used everything else, except plot title. void TRUE FALSE: removes axis elements. Suggested maps. grid_x TRUE FALSE: adds x gridlines. grid_y TRUE FALSE: adds y gridlines. base_size Base text size. base_line_size Base line size. base_rect_size Base rectangle size.

title: A ggplot2 theme for Blanco Center visualizations — theme_bc
text: ggplot2 theme.
